subject: Travel
title: Handshake Rules Worldwide
description: Learn Handshake Rules Worldwide in one minute.

hook.text: A firm handshake impresses Americans. In many African countries, a limp grip shows respect.

buildup.text: In Russia, shaking hands across a doorway is terrible luck. You must step inside first.

discovery.text: In South Korea, you support your right elbow with your left hand when shaking with an elder.

twist.text: In Morocco, handshakes can last several minutes. Pulling away too fast signals you don't care.

climax.text: Many Hindu and Buddhist cultures avoid handshakes entirely. Physical touch between strangers is avoided.

punchline.text: One gesture, a hundred ways to get it wrong.

quiz.question: Why should you not shake hands in a Russian doorway?
